alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Wrangell (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 15 at 7:21AM AKDT until September 16 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following area, Southern Inner Channels. This includes the city of Wrangell. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT today. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An atmospheric river has so far brought 2 to 4 inches of rainfall since Thursday morning. Some rain rates have been heavy with upwards of 0.25 inches per hour observed at times. the heavy rainfall will stay in area through the morning with another half an inch of rainfall expected. Area rivers and streams have been showing rises in water levels but no flooding has been observed, yet. Minor flooding is possible especially for the smaller streams as they respond to the heavy rain.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
